page.title: 16HISTORICAL MOUNTSORREL
page.content: {Buttermarket:}Built in 1793 by John Danvers to replace The Cross at the centre of Mountsorrel.It was used for selling dairy produce,but now is used as a shelter and a meeting place. {Churches:}Canon Crate is the vicar of Christchurch,Rothley Rd. and at St. Peters,on Loughboro' Rd.,since Mr Bells death.The four other churches are;a Baptist,a Methodist, and a Christadelphian. {Schools:}1742,Charity school for boys was built.1847,infant school built,then in 1871 two more schools built.The one on Rothley Rd. has been extended and is now the only school in the village.It caters for both infants and juniors on one site. {Glenfrith Hospital:}Originally a home for orphans and then tramps.It is now a home for the mentally handicapped.
